course_title: Research Topics in Political Science: India Today: Innov., Sustainab
class_notes: This research seminar focuses social change, development, domestic and foreign policy, and innovation in various sectors such as healthcare, corporate governance, technology, energy and the environment. We will also learn about prime-time television news, newspapers, digital-born media, as well as social media platforms, and sources of influence on public opinion. India's diverse media landscape and political party systems will be discussed in the context of political campaigning in recent national and subnational elections, as the country approaches state assembly elections in a number of key states in April and May.
course_description: Research on selected topics and problems in political science. Class will fulfill the "research" requirement for the political science major. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: POLS 208 or POLS_OX 208 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 2634, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 4-6:45p, Instructor: H. Semetko, Status: Open
